TextView.android:text: iWater helps users identify the public water systems being utilized in any location. The app retrieves public water system data from the Safe Drinking Water Information System, a feature of Envirofacts, an online database provided by the Environmental Protection Agency.

From the EPA website: 'The Safe Drinking Water Information System (SDWIS) contains information about public water systems and their violations of EPA's drinking water regulations, as reported to EPA by the states. These regulations establish maximum contaminant levels, treatment techniques, and monitoring and reporting requirements to ensure that water systems provide safe water to their customers.'
Anyone can play a part in keeping our source water clean. Here are some easy ways you can protect drinking water sources:

Put up signs 
Dispose of harmful materials, like pesticides and paint cans, properly. 
Join in a beach, stream or wetland cleanup. 
Organize a storm drain stenciling project. 
Prepare a presentation about your watershed for a school or civic organization.
